decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to control the board through a combination of lands and spells. By utilizing cards like Wasteland, Dark Depths, and Thespian's Stage, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up its own powerful board presence. With cards like Life from the Loam and Exploration to help ramp up mana production and Boseiju, Who Endures to protect key spells, the deck can outmaneuver opponents and grind out wins through attrition. Ultimately, the deck thrives on resource denial and strategic land plays to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Murktide Regent, Archon of Cruelty, and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Entomb and Reanimate. It also utilizes disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo. The deck aims to reanimate big threats as early as possible, overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures and controlling the game with cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Brazen Borrower. It also includes land disruption with Wasteland to further control the opponent's resources.

The deck is built around a combo where the player aims to quickly mill themselves using cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer, putting Thassa's Oracle onto the battlefield with no cards left in their library to win the game. The deck includes many fast mana sources and protection in the form of Pact of Negation and Duress to disrupt opposing strategies and ensure the combo can go off smoothly. The key is to execute the combo as quickly and efficiently as possible to secure a victory in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo as quickly as possible for a win condition. The deck utilizes cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble for card advantage and Urza's Saga for searching out key pieces. It also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor to protect the combo. The deck aims to control the board while setting up the combo, and can also utilize Urza's Bauble and other artifacts for additional synergy.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively utilize artifacts, particularly blue artifacts, to overwhelm the opponent. By using cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mox Opal to generate mana and bring back artifacts from the graveyard, along with disruptive spells like Force of Will, the deck aims to control the board while maintaining a fast and aggressive tempo. The inclusion of cards like Lavaspur Boots and Sink into Stupor provide additional utility and disruption, making it a versatile aggro deck that can quickly build up a threatening board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will. The deck focuses on a mix of aggressive creatures like Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, along with efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending. Additionally, the inclusion of disruptive cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Dress Down helps to control the pace of the game and protect the deck's threats. The mana base is designed to support the deck's heavy blue and black requirements while also providing some disruption with Wasteland.

The deck focuses on using Smallpox and other disruptive spells to control the game while utilizing Life from the Loam to recur lands and generate value. The deck also includes a strong land destruction package with cards like Wasteland and Urza's Saga. Grist, the Hunger Tide provides additional threats and synergy with sacrificing creatures. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value and advantage through its control elements and land recursion.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bring them back into play with Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent with cards like Daze and Force of Will while also using cards like Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to find key pieces of the combo. Murktide Regent and Brazen Borrower provide additional threats and disruption, while Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archon of Cruelty offer powerful finishers for the deck.

This deck aims to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Murktide Regent, then use reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield for a quick win. It also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to control the opponent's game plan and protect its own combo pieces. The deck is designed to be fast and efficient, utilizing card selection with Brainstorm and Ponder to find the necessary combo pieces to win the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively play creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan using cards like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy. The deck also utilizes sacrifice effects such as Goblin Bombardment to deal additional damage. The inclusion of Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides a strong finisher and the deck also has some land disruption with Wasteland. Overall, the strategy of this Mardu Aggro deck is to apply constant pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combo between Cephalid Illusionist, Nomads en-Kor, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to mill the library, followed by using Dread Return to bring back Thassa's Oracle for a win condition. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo. The deck aims to assemble the combo pieces quickly while controlling the opponent's plays to secure a win through milling or the Thassa's Oracle win condition.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Murktide Regent, and Orcish Bowmasters, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Daze. The deck also utilizes powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt to deal with opposing threats. The mana base is built to support the deck's three-color combination, allowing for a consistent and aggressive gameplay style in the Legacy format.

This deck aims to quickly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal. By leveraging efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, along with versatile cards like Mishra's Bauble and Force of Will, the deck can apply pressure while keeping the opponent on the back foot. With a mix of card advantage from Brainstorm and Ponder and disruption from Daze and Wasteland, the deck looks to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on utilizing fast mana sources like Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond to generate large amounts of mana quickly, allowing the player to cast multiple spells in a single turn and build up storm count. The key goal is to assemble the necessary pieces to effectively use Tendrils of Agony as a finisher, either by casting it directly or by finding it through cards like Infernal Tutor or Burning Wish. The deck also includes disruption in the form of discard spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to protect the combo.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bring them back onto the battlefield using Reanimate. The deck also includes counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its combo pieces. The use of creatures with evasion like Dauthi Voidwalker and Brazen Borrower helps to ensure that the reanimated creatures can connect with the opponent. Additionally, Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card draw and filtering to help find the necessary combo pieces. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and disruption spells.

The main concept of this Aggro - Artifacts Blue deck is to quickly play out powerful artifacts and creatures, utilizing cards like Force of Will and Urza's Bauble for card advantage and control. Emry, Lurker of the Loch serves as both a recursion engine and a threat on the board, while Urza's Saga provides additional artifact tokens for further aggression. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and synergistic artifact-based strategy, combining aggressive creatures like Kappa Cannoneer with disruptive spells like Sink into Stupor to maintain board control and pressure.
